snippet: The current system allows for Electoral College votes to be split between candidates and parties, and gives Democrats a chance to win a vote in a conservative state.
abstract: Nebraska Legislature votes to retain unusual system that allows state to split its Electoral College votes between candidates and parties; rejection of proposal to adopt winner-take-all system, used by 48 states, gives Democrats chance to take at least one electoral vote from majority-Republican state.
lead_paragraph: The current system allows for Electoral College votes to be split between candidates and parties, and gives Democrats a chance to win a vote in a conservative state.

headline.main: Nebraska Legislature Rejects Winner-Take-All Electoral Vote System
headline.print_headline: Conservative Bid to Adopt a Winner-Take-All Electoral System in Nebraska Fails
